name: Kate Gosselin
religion: Gosselin is a devout Pentecostal Christian.
politicalViews: Gosselin is probably a bit right of center because of her stance on abortion. Other than that, she seems mostly non-political.
author: Tom Kershaw

content.text: Kate Gosselin, born Katie Kreider, was born in Hershey, Pennsylvania.

content.sourceTitle: The so-called "secrets" that Kate Gosselin of Jon & Kate Plus 8 never want you to find out
content.text: Gosselin's father is a pastor and (I'm not sure if he still is) ministers to the Calvary Bible Church in Sinking Spring, Pennsylvania.,
a non-denominational or possibly evangelical Christian church.
Wikipedia claims that Gosselin's mother was Jewish, but offers no source

content.sourceTitle: Kate Gosselin: "Bible-Believing Christian" Who Hopes to Inspire Moms
content.text: and I can find no corroborating evidence. However, even if it's true, Kate has definitely kept to her Christian faith and has described herself as a "Bible-believing Christian." And she attends a Pentecostal Assembly of God church just outside of Philadelphia.
Gosselin claims that the producers of her show, , have edited out any trace of her faith in post-production, but she's OK with it, saying:

content.sourceTitle: Kate Gosselin: "Bible-Believing Christian" Who Hopes to Inspire Moms
content.text: If [the producers] opt to edit out our faith, I know by now it hasn't gone unnoticed… because we receive more e-mails from people who 'just knew we were Christians' than I can count. Additionally, we receive more requests from churches to speak than I can fulfill!

content.sourceTitle: Kate Gosselin Gets Religion: A New Book from "Kate Plus 8″ Star on Family and Faith
content.text: Gosselin additionally wrote about her faith in her tell-all book, , regaling readers with stories of divine providence, such as when she was inspired to send a check to a family in need and found an anonymous gift card to a big box superstore for the same amount that very day.
We can surely count her among the Christian faithful.
If you can run a household with eight kids, why not the whole country?
Gosselin's political views are not explicit. We do know that she's anti-abortion. She tweeted:
RT @PersonhoodFL: #Abortion has killed over 27,000,000 preborn girls. Think abortion advocates care about women?

It could be an attempt to discredit liberals who claimed the Republican Party was anti-women leading up to the 2012 elections. We don't know, but it certainly puts her on the right side of the aisle on one issue.

content.sourceTitle: Kate Gosselin, Stay Out of Politics!
content.text: Gosselin went camping once with Republican vice-presidential candidate Sarah Palin, but she seemed to hate it.

content.sourceTitle: One Rough Camping Trip Later, Kate Thinks She Has Political Ambitions
content.text: However, some "anonymous friends" reported that Gosselin expressed an interest in going into politics herself after spending a day with Palin.
Perhaps contradictorily, Gosselin expressed an interest in assisting Michelle Obama with her initiative to fight childhood obesity, tweeting:

content.sourceTitle: Kate Gosselin wants to collaborate with Michelle Obama to promote fitness
content.text: I'd love to help M Obama in her quest. It's SO my passion :) for kids, moms & families as a whole!

Categories.value: Flickr images reviewed by trusted users|Kate Gosselin|Taken with Sony DSC-H2
